entries.meaning: (literally) A support structure comprising joined parts or conglomerated particles and intervening open spaces of similar or larger size.
(literally) The arrangement of support beams that represent a building's general shape and size.
(figuratively) The larger branches of a tree that determine its shape.

examples: These ‘three principles of connexion’ compose the framework of principles in Hume's account of the association of ideas.

entries.meaning: (software engineering) A reusable piece of code (and, sometimes, other utilities) providing a standard environment within which an application can be implemented.
examples: Hyponyms: architectural framework, entity framework, software framework
